content.text:
# List of French Academy Award winners and nominees

This is a list of French Academy Award winners and nominees. This list details the performances of French actors, actresses, and films that have either been submitted or nominated for, or have won, an Academy Award (The Oscars). This list is current as of the 96th Academy Awards ceremony held on March 10, 2024.
Best Actor
Leading

|-
| align="center"| 1990 || Gérard Depardieu || Cyrano de Bergerac ||  || First actor to be nominated for a French-speaking role.
|-
| align="center"| 2011|| Jean Dujardin|| The Artist|| || First French actor to win Best Actor.
|-
| align="center"| 2017|| rowspan=2| Timothée Chalamet || Call Me by Your Name|| || Chalamet is a French-American actor born in the United States. At age 22, it made him the third-youngest Best Actor nominee.

|-
| align="center"| 1965 || Simone Signoret || Ship of Fools ||  || Third French actress to receive more than one nomination.

|-
| align="center"| 1992 || Catherine Deneuve || Indochine ||  ||
|-
| align="center"| 2000 || Juliette Binoche || Chocolat ||  || First and only French actress to be nominated for both Leading and Supporting categories.Fifth French actress to receive more than one nomination.
|-
| align="center"| 2008 || Marion Cotillard ||  ||  || First actress to win for a French-speaking role.Third French actress to win Best Actress.
|-
| align="center"| 2012 || Emmanuelle Riva || Amour ||  || Oldest Best Actress nominee in the history.
|-
| align="center"| 2014 || Marion Cotillard || Two Days, One Night ||  || Sixth French actress to receive more than one nomination, the second to be nominated for two French-speaking roles and the first to be nominated for a Belgian film.
|-
| align="center"| 2016 || Isabelle Huppert || Elle ||  ||

Honorary Awards
This list focuses on French-born recipients of the Honorary Award
{| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" width="100%" cellpadding="5"
|-
! width="50"|Year
! width="200"|Recipient
! width="325"| Milestone / Notes
|-
| 1942
| Charles Boyer
| "for his progressive cultural achievement in establishing the French Research Foundation in Los Angeles as a source of reference for the Hollywood Motion Picture Industry"
|-
| 1958
| Maurice Chevalier
| "for his contributions to the world of entertainment for more than half a century."
|-
| 1973
| Henri Langlois
| "for his devotion to the art of film, his massive contributions in preserving its past and his unswerving faith in its future."
|-
| 1974
| Jean Renoir
|"a genius who, with grace, responsibility and enviable devotion through silent film, sound film, feature, documentary and television, has won the world's admiration."
|-
| 2010
| Jean-Luc Godard
|"For passion. For confrontation. For a new kind of cinema."
|-
| 2014
| Jean-Claude Carrière
|"Whose elegantly crafted screenplays elevate the art of screenwriting to the level of literature."
|-
| 2017
| Agnès Varda
|"Her compassion and curiosity inform a uniquely personal cinema."
|}
